New Records: Smith struck out 12 batters in the ALDS, setting a new MLB record for a reliever in a division series.
Steven Kwan became the first Cleveland player and third in MLB history to collect three hits or more in three straight postseason games.
Kwan extended his playoff hitting streak to 10 games, matching Kenny Lofton in 1995 for the franchise record.
Kwan’s 20 hits are the most by a Cleveland player through 12 career playoff games, passing Lofton’s 18 in 1995.
Kwan’s 11 hits in the ALDS are a new club record for a single division series, besting his own record of nine from the 2022 ALDS against New York.
Key Match Events: Lane Thomas hit a grand slam in the fifth inning off Skubal, made possible by Kwan’s one-out base hit.
Smith pitched 6 1/3 innings with a 1.42 ERA and 0.47 WHIP, appearing in all five games of the division series.
Pre-Game Insights: Tigers manager A.J. Hinch called Kwan the 'engine' for Cleveland that 'creates a lot of pressure.'
Kwan said the extra rest between the end of the regular season and the playoff opener last week and his time on the injured list in September also helped his performance.
Post-Match Reflections: Smith said he is not taking a second of the experience for granted and that he is a part of something special.
Hinch praised Smith for the volume of work that he produced throughout the series and his ability to remain at a high level through all five outings.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Weather did not significantly impact the match.
Cleveland Guardians put away the Tigers and advanced to a showdown with the Yankees.
The game was part of the American League Division Series, not the specific date mentioned in the query.
